description: Single storey rear extension following demolition of existing conservatory; alteration of roof to raise ridge height and insertion of a window to the front gable end; side roof extensions and incorporation of a Juliet balcony to the rear gable end
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): 20-2020/36MC/300 Rev B (ground floor plan-proposed); 20-2020/36MC/301 Rev B (first floor plan, proposed); 20-2020/36MC/302 Rev B (roof plan-proposed); 20-2020/36MC/303 Rev B (proposed street elevation); 20-2020/36MC/304 Rev B (proposed side elevation); 20-2020/36MC/305 Rev B (proposed side elevation); 20-2020/36MC/306 Rev B (proposed rear elevation)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| All external materials to be used in the development shall match those of the existing building unless indicated on the approved plans or application form. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), London Plan(2021) policies D1, D3 and D4 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), London Plan(2021) policies D3 and D4 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| No part of the flat roof of the development  hereby approved shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A  and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013);  London Plan(2021) policies D3 and D4. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment, revision or new Order) no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason:  To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1, D3 and D4 of the London Plan(2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
